details.content:
Trivandrum: Kerala Finance Minister TM Thomas Isaac presents the budget in the state legislative assembly. pic.twitter.com/pm3vwq25OE

— ANI (@ANI) 31 January 2019
Kerala finance minister announces Rs 1000 crore for Kudumbashree mission in Kerala.
State to set up rice technology parks in Alappuzha, Thrissur, Palakkad

The state approved semi-high-speed train service project by drawing two additional lines adjacent to the existing railway lines. The project would be completed in seven years and the project is estimated to cost Rs 56,000 crore.
Rs 20 crore has been allocated for agriculture promotion in Kuttanad
Rs 20 crores for providing subsidized provisions from Civil Supplies to organisations involved in hunger eradication programme
Rs 20 crores for providing subsidized provisions from Civil Supplies to organisations involved in hunger eradication programme
A sum of Rs 43 crore earmarked for Kera Gramam project

Kerala Finance Minister TM Thomas Isaac in state legislative assembly: Rebuilding after the floods is a challenge before us. After floods, Sabarimala violence was the second disaster in the state. pic.twitter.com/ggPm28PRRR

— ANI (@ANI) 31 January 2019
Rs 1420 crore allotted for women empowerment programmes
Rs100 crore for Nava Kerala mission, 25 new projects to be announced
Rs 20 crore for arranging basic facilities to promote boat race including Champions league of Tourism department
Outer ring road will be constructed in Thiruvanathapuram

details.title: Watch live presentation of Kerala budget here

details.content: Rs 11,867 crore for local self governments. Gram Panchayats will get Rs 6,384 crore while bloc/jilla panchayat will get Rs 2,654 crore
25,000 financially backward women to be given a daily wage of Rs 400-600
Tribal and other small scale cottage industries to be branded.
Renaissance-research museum to be built in state capital of Thiruvananthapuram
Local PWD institutions to get Rs 1000 crore
Rs 73 crore allowed for Thiruvananthapuram Regional Cancer Centre and Rs 35 crore for Malabar Cancer Centre
Rs 170 crore for development of government schools
Muziris heritage project to be completed in the financial year 2020-21

details.title: Rs 200 crore for development of Sabarimala roads
details.content: Rs 147.75 crore allotted to basic infra development of Pampa and Nilakkal. Ranni and Nilakkal to get new parking facilities. Rs 200 crore set-aside for the development of Sabarimala roads.
Pampa to have waste water treatment plant with a capacity of one crore liters. Rs 40 crore has been allotted for the project.
Kerala start ups to receive Rs 70 crore
The number if IT employees in the state to be increased to 2 lakh from 1 lakh
10 per cent entertainment tax imposed, prices of movie tickets to shoot up
